meanings.definition: A vehicle with four wheels drawn by horses or other power, used for transporting people or goods.
meanings.sent1: The carriages rolled smoothly along the cobblestone road.
meanings.sent2: The royal family arrived in their luxurious carriages for the parade.
meanings.sent3: The carriages seemed to gossip with each other as they waited outside the theater.
meanings.sent4: The carriages stood like loyal steeds, ready to carry their passengers to their destinations.
meanings.sent5: The carriages gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of elegance and tradition.

meanings.definition: The manner in which a person holds and moves their body while walking or running.
meanings.sent1: Her graceful carriages caught the attention of everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: He walked with a confident carriages that demanded respect.
meanings.sent3: The carriages of the dancers added to the beauty of their performance.
meanings.sent4: With a regal carriages, she entered the room like a queen.
meanings.sent5: His carriages exuded strength and determination as he crossed the finish line.

meanings.definition: The act of carrying or transporting something.
meanings.sent1: The carriages of the ants carrying food back to their nest fascinated the children.
meanings.sent2: The carriages of the workers moving boxes in the warehouse never seemed to stop.
meanings.sent3: The carriages of the wind carried the scent of flowers through the open window.
meanings.sent4: The carriages of the river brought nutrients downstream to nourish the soil.
meanings.sent5: The carriages of the clouds carried rain across the sky, watering the thirsty fields.
